headline: √âclair Cake
description: This easy √©clair cake requires no baking, feeds a crowd, and tastes just like the famous pastry. An impressively simple 5-ingredient dessert!

video.description: This no-bake cake has layers of deliciousness, and couldn‚Äôt be simpler.
video.name: √âclair Cake

name: √âclair Cake
recipeIngredient: 1 (8 ounce) container frozen whipped topping, thawed
2 (3.5 ounce) packages instant vanilla pudding mix

recipeInstructions.text: Stir milk, whipped topping, and pudding mix together in a medium bowl until well combined.

Arrange a single layer of graham cracker squares in the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking pan. Evenly spread half of the pudding mixture over the crackers; top with another layer of crackers and the remaining pudding mixture. Top with a final layer of graham crackers. Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Spread frosting over the chilled cake up to the edges of the pan. Cover again and chill for at least 3 1/2 hours before serving.

review.reviewBody: I made this using flaxseed milk as my daughter has a dairy allergy. Then used the coconut ready whip to mix into the pudding since we can't use cool whip. Lastly instead of spreading the chocolate frosting, I melted it over the stove and peed it over for a shiny 'eclair' like finish. Since I could not use cool whip, I had the container out so that people can just put it on top of the eclair when they were eating it for the people who are not dairy-free. Everyone liked it a lot. I gave it a four rating because it got a bit mushy, but I made it the day before so I wasn't sure if that was supposed to happen. But maybe next time I will double up on the graham crackers for each layer instead and maybe that would help it not be so soft and still be able to see the layers. I have to get better at getting a picture of the entire dessert.
Easy, peasy! Took it for a potluck and by the time I got through the line it was all gone! Next time, it's two!
Loved the recipe! I used cream cheese pudding and added 1 8oz box cream cheese to pudding mix. It was so good
I LOVED IT!!!! It was so easy to make and i enjoyed all of the extra frosting!!!!!
Made it for a Superbowl party last night. People were raving about it. I did use a chocolate ganache instead of frosting. Will make again soon!!!
I loved how quick easy and efficient it was! My kids can make this safely at home and it's great for selling at our grocery store with minimal expense! To top it off its delicious üòã!

Love It! I make it Diabetic Friendly. I use Sugar Free pudding and sugar free Pillsbury Choc Icy. It really helps to cut the sugar, and my husband loves it. He has Diabetic 2 and we keep his sugar intake down. NO one can tell I use sugar free in it. My marry children do not eat ''anything sugar free." This they do, but don't know my secret and ask for it all the time. To make it interesting colorful, try layering 1 layer Vanilla pudding and 1 layer Choc sugar free pudding. Very good. And diabetic friendly, also can omit the middle layer of graham crackers, just bottom and top use the graham crackers to make it much more diabetic friendly. Haven't been able to find sugar free graham crackers. My next one, I am thinking about using 1 small box sugar free Orange Gelatin my vanilla pudding mixture. (No water) just the powder Jello.
Excellent. Served at our group dinner and everyone wanted recipe. So easy. I made a chocolate ganache (dark chocolate chips) in place of icing. One box of graham wafers was just enough .

I have been making a similar recipe for years. One of our family favorites. I usually make it with banana pudding mix. Also have used chocolate pudding and vanilla frosting. I add mint flavor to vanilla pudding and sprinkle crushed peppermint candies to the top for Christmas.
Loved üòç it
Recipe was clear and I could follow it. Had to come here , another site had so much junk flying thru it , I couldn't read or follow it. Thank you.

Super easy I made mine with sugar free vanilla pudding mix and chocolate frosting, I dusted one of the layers with sugar free cocoa and instant expresso perfection!! No guilt. ü§£ I love eclairs and Tiramusu but had to give up sugar a few months ago, this recipe helps.
I‚Äôve been making this eclair cake for years, and it‚Äôs always a hit with my family and friends.
It tastes more like an eclair if you use banana cream pudding. I like melting chocolate chips to top mine off with. Semi-sweet ones of course. Tastes more like an eclair. easy and quick dessert.

LOVE this recipe! I was taught to use French Vanilla pudding. I keep the ingredients on hand, since it's so easy to put together in a pinch. I've never tried dipping the Graham crackers in milk 1st...may try that next time

This is an easy, DELICIOUS recipe! I get requests to make it at least once every holiday season. I add a bit of pure vanilla extract to the pudding mixture to intensify the vanilla flavor. I also use whipped cream instead of cool whip (lots of grocery stores now sell containers of fresh whipped cream in their bakeries). Serve it with a dollop of the fresh whipped cream for an extra layer of flavor. I recommend taking the time to make it the night before- it really does allow the dessert to set into a perfect texture. It's a great "semi-homemade" dessert to serve this time of year.
One of our favorite desserts....very easy to make.....I have tried different frostings and our favorite is dark chocolate....
I made this and it was the hit of the party. I've been asked to make over 15 of these. It is easy to make and all my grandkids love to make it all I do is supervise now. Love this cake.!!!

If you want to put a really yummy Brazilian twist on this very good recipe, replace the chocolate frosting with a brigadeiro topping. Brigadeiro is comprised of 1 can of sweetened condensed milk (we love the Eagle brand), 2 TB of butter, and 4 TB of Nestle Chocolate Quik powder. Heat all of these ingredients over the stove on medium high. Once the mixture thickens to the point that it no longer sticks to the bottom of the pan, turn off the stove and let cool for a couple of minutes. Once ready, spread mixture over the eclair just as you would the chocolate frosting. As another option, you could top it off with strawberries or chocolate sprinkles. Enjoy!
Absolutely delicious! Didn‚Äôt change a thing!

This doesn't really taste like an √©clair, although it's still a good dessert. It is a lot of cream and best eaten in small servings. The ratio of taste to the level of effort is high, so a great recipe overall.
I've been using this recipe for about 30 years. I just hadn't made it for a while and was a little rusty on the pudding and cool whip. It is a fantastic dessert, that quick and everyone likes it.

I used white chocolate pudding and milk chocolate icing. It came out a little bit sweet for me, my mom loved it. I think the next time I make it I will stick to the recipe and use vanilla pudding and regular chocolate icing for my taste
I made with vanilla pudding and about 3/4 amount of whipped cream. It taste very good next day, but even better after 2,3 day later. Great dessert for warmer weather.
We first started making this Eclair Cake in the early 1980s. My family still loves it. so easy to make.
Made this twice but made chocolate ganache instead of frosting. It‚Äôs a big hit.

This is a great and easy desert. I added 2 T. water to the frosting so it would spread easier. I didn't use the whole can. It didn't need to be that thick. The chocolate taste of so much frosting over powered the taste of the Eclair Cake.
I made this with cinnamon graham crackers and used vanilla frosting - yummy!

I've made this many times over the years, with only two small differences. If you can find it, the French Vanilla pudding mix is better. Also, melt the chocolate RTS icing briefly in the microwave, then just pour over the cake. Easy peasy!

I found this cake when I visited an Amish store in PA. I would always pick up some every time I went but no more. This is exactly the same and my friends and family all love it and it is so easy to make!
We made ours suger free!! Omg amazing
My pudding came out too liquid not sure why because I have made it as per instructions.. even in the video when you whisk ingredients it looks same as mine but after it looks thicker..

Had low expectations for this no bake with packaged ingredients, but made it as a fast dessert for New Years. Boy was I wrong, it was fantastic! For those who found it bland, try adding a teaspoon of vanilla extract to the pudding for more flavor dimension. Made a simple homemade fudge frosting bc I don‚Äôt like sweet, artificial tub frostings. Next time, I‚Äôd make with whipped heavy cream in place of the cool whip for less sugar. This recipe would be good with chocolate Graham‚Äôs, and chocolate pudding with espresso powder for a mocha cake. Options are endless. Thank you for a fast, simple, delicious recipe.
We absolutely ?? ? ? ?? iT, incredibly easy and I read another comment to eat right away soak wafers in milk for seconds, haven't tried that yet ??
I have made this for at least 35 years. Its easy and taste delicious. I have also tried it with butter scotch pudding and strawberry pudding ,both flavors were great.
Super easy to make, and my dinner guests were Wowed! A staple in my dessert rotation.
I made it exactly like the recipe and turned out delicious. It's obviously pretty sweet, but still light and it was a big hit for Father's Day dessert. Will definitely make it again.
I‚Äôve loved this recipe for years. I like to add about 4 oz cream cheese to the pudding mix to give it some body.
Good stuff!!

Use French Vanilla pudding and microwave the frosting for 15 seconds once or twice to pour it over the top layer 
Pretty close to an eclair
I use french vanilla instant pudding and milk chocolate frosting. It tastes so much better to me.
My family loves this recipe for the flavor, and I love it because it's easy.

My family Loves this cake. Easy to make and inexpensive for a large family. You can do so much with this recipe. I used banana pudding. U can also do white chocolate with chocolate graham crackers. It's all so yummy!
One of the best things I've ever had and so easy.
Easy, inexpensive and very well received!
The whole family loved this!

This turned out great!! Like most people I did make a few changes but they were 100% in the spirit of the original. I used whipped cream versus cool whip and I made a ganache instead of canned frosting. I was surprised as how easy and how good it was!!
Perfect! And very fulfilling.
We liked it! I easily halved the recipe with no problems. The frosting..once it‚Äôs in the fridge makes them a little messy to cut, but these are delish nonetheless.
Awwwwwwwwesome!!!????????

I‚Äôm giving this three stars because it just didn‚Äôt wow us. It was moderately tasty and very easy to make but it was lacking flavor. Also, the graham cracker disintegrated, so there wasn‚Äôt really a ‚Äúcake‚Äù layer. Loved the easy frosting idea. I did warm it up and poured it over the cake. I will use that frosting method again.
I made this a few weeks ago for a dinner party, and everyone loved it. I followed the recipe as written and it was quite easy.
I made this exactly as written and we loved it! I was worried it would be mushy or not have a great texture, but it was delicious! Can't wait to make it again!
My family loved this, and it's perfect for children, seniors, etc. Excellent in the hot summer months.

This is awesome recipe! I did use fat free and sugar free pudding, and almond milk and added a teaspoon of vanilla. Because of the almond milk the pudding didn‚Äôt set up as firm as it should and I used Dark Chocolate frosting heated so I pretty much poured it on the cake. It is delicious and my husband was very happy I found this to make a few changes to make it much better for diabetics.

I‚Äôve made this a couple of times. I use sugar free instant pudding, and sugar free frosting, and if I can find it sugar free whipped topping. We have diabetics in the family. The recipe turns out delicious!! And warming the frosting in the microwave works great.
To spread the frosting much easier I put the can of frosting in the microwave for 30 seconds and then you can pour the chocolate over the dessert!
To spread the frosting much easier I put the can of frosting in the microwave for 30 seconds and then you can pour the chocolate over the dessert!
I changed the recipe and added pecans into the cool whip and put Bosco Chocolate Mint Cookie Flavored Syrup on top.
My family love this recipe. It was devoured. Easy but yet simple to make.

I followed the recipe along with the suggestion to put the container of frosting in the microwave for 30 seconds to make it easier to spread. It was perfect! My husband is a big fan of chocolate eclairs & he loved this desert. I will be making this again and again.
I used sugar free pudding, extra creamy cool whip and with the store bought frosting i mixed in cream cheese so its not so sweet ;)
It was good, but the store bought icing does not taste as good as a homemade chocolate sauce would. Other than that, it was pretty good.

Exceptionally Good ! You do have to microwave the chocolate frosting for 30 seconds or make your own chocolate sauce ( mix 1/3 cup cocoa powder, 1/3 cup sugar, 1 stick of butter bring to boil for 1 min asd tdp Vanilla ) . Next time I will dip the crackers in Amaretto for a Tiramisu taste !
My family‚Äôs favorIte. I make it a couple of times each month. I have been using French Vanilla pudding as I believe it adds a little more flavor.
My family enjoyed it but my husband said it wasn‚Äôt guest or dinner party worthy. It‚Äôs a very casual type dessert.
Sinfully rich. My family absolutely loved it. I appreciate the ease & will definitely make this again
all I can say is yummmmmy

Super easy and delicious. Followed other reviewers suggestions and used chocolate graham crackers and made my own chocolate sauce. Everyone really enjoyed this dessert. A keeper recipe I plan to make again and again. Next time will try regular graham crackers and cheese cake pudding. Thanks for this great recipe!
So easy to make and so good !
Quick and easy. Made it with the kids. They had a great time and love the cake.
Love this recipe! I change the pudding favor from vanilla to French vanilla and also I melt the frosting and pour over the cake instead of waiting for it to chill! Works great!
Super easy recipe. Big hit! Made in (2) 8x8 pans instead.
Assemble then put in fridge for a couple hours before frosting. Heat frosting a little bit and spread on top of Graham's. Back in fridge till serving.
OMG delicious! I substituted a 7oz package of vanilla mousse I had instead of pudding so no whip cream needed and only half the milk. It does take an entire box of graham crackers. Will make again ?

My granddaughter and I made this and it is delicious! 
The only thing we did differently is we heated the frosting in the microwave for about 20 seconds. Stir well and just pour it over the top.
Waaaay easier than trying to spread it.

I followed other reviewrs' advice and use homemade ganache for the topping, but that is mostly personal preference. I make this often as it is a quick and easy favorite for family gatherings and potlucks. Just remember, it really does need to be done in advance so the Graham crackers can soften up!

Everyone raves over this cake when I make it. When we have a dinner at church, people always request that I bring this. I also make a "diabetic friendly" version also for my stepdad with sugar free ingredients.
Everyone loved and some went back for seconds
Delicioouuussss!
Maybe banana pudding instead. Tasted like a dessert from a cafeteria. Hubby and I were not impressed. My parents liked it though.

Only a 4 star because I made a couple of changes , then had to rush the time. It tasted great with my changes, I used cooked pudding, because I can‚Äôt stand the taste of instant, but I didn‚Äôt let it cool completely, before blending in fresh whipped cream, also can‚Äôt stand Cool Whip. Only had 3 hours to chill, and result was Eclair Soup. I should have thought about Cool Whip probably having a stiffening agent that fresh whipped doesn‚Äôt have, although I added a teaspoon of cream of tartar while whipping. Anyone know anything else I might have messed up? Otherwise, people liked the taste, even though they had to eat it with a spoon. That‚Äôs what I get when I only bake for company, and always want to try something new, and always want to tweak it!

I took this cake to my daughters for Christmas. Everyone LOVED it....and no one knew I made it with sugar-free pudding and sugar-free frosting!!! They were all shocked when I told them. I have a feeling the family will be requesting this cake often. Yummy cake and so easy to make!
It was very easy to make and whenever I make it everyone is always asking me to make it again. So yummy!!

I‚Äôve made this for many years. I like to use cheesecake pudding , extra creamy cool whip, cinnamon gram crackers and dark chocolate fudge frosting melted in the microwave. Everyone that eats it RAVES about it. Yummo and how ready!!

I‚Äôve made this for many years. I like to use cheesecake pudding , extra creamy cool whip, cinnamon gram crackers and dark chocolate fudge frosting melted in the microwave. Everyone that eats it RAVES about it. Yummo and how ready!!

Used sugar free pudding, frosting and cool whip - Awesome!! So good, in fact, I'm asked to bring it to church functions. 
Church lady approved ??!!
Best dessert yet. Didn't last but a day.

I grew up with my mom making this and now I do it for gatherings, as requested by the attendees. The only thing I do different than this recipe is; instead of using regular icing which is hard to spread on this bc of the pudding, I use chocolate topping for ice cream which hardens and spreads super easily.

This is always a hit during the holidays! Our little trick is to heat the frosting (in the container) and pour over top. It‚Äôs easy and always comes out smooth and perfect! 
*remove lid and foil from the frosting and heat in 20 second intervals until melted
Love it

I have made this several times and it is delicious. I used good quality graham crackers (the store brand crackers didn't soften enough), french vanilla pudding, I nuked the frosting for 30 seconds and it poured beautifully, and I made this the day before
serving it. So easy!!
super easy! everyone loves it. I've also used Nutella instead of icing. That's a big hit, too!
It was tasty and great for a hot day so you don't have to heat up an oven. After a couple of days the texture was very soft.
Great and easy
perhaps the easiest dessert to make and takes no time at all. Best if you make it the day before an event, although a few hours will do if you're in a pinch.

Dairy Free adjustments - I used vanilla soy milk instead of cows milk. This turned out fine but I need to add one extra package of instant vanilla putting, making it 3 cups of soy milk vanilla to 3 packages of instant pudding mix. Everyone loved it! I cut the pieces big, too yummy!

This is an easy and delicious recipe.....the first time i made it exactly like directions said....found that the frosting was way to sweet for me. The second time i did it, i used hersheys magic shell instead giving it a thinner layer of chocolate that was just enough....everyone loved it

Oh so easy!! As far as the chocolate frosting at the end goes, I have found that if you stick the whole jar of chocolate frosting in the microwave for 10-20 seconds it will melt it enough to POUR it over the cake!!
